heroIntro: Discover your perfect Mediterranean escape in this exceptional 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow located in the charming pueblo of Salinas, Vera. With Blue Flag beaches just 20 minutes away, championship golf courses nearby, and a welcoming international community, you'll find everything needed for the ultimate sunshine retreat. Whether you're seeking a second home for extended getaways or a rental investment generating approximately €800 per week, this property delivers both lifestyle and financial potential. areaSection: Vera is a picturesque coastal town in eastern Almería, positioned perfectly between the lively coastal resort of Garrucha and the quieter inland villages of the region. The town sits just 20 minutes from the famous Playa de Vera, consistently awarded Blue Flag status for its pristine waters and excellent facilities. Vera enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers ideal for Mediterranean living. The area benefits from a unique microclimate, with mountains sheltering it from northern winds while allowing sea breezes to keep temperatures pleasant. Unlike the overcrowded Costa del Sol, Vera maintains its authentic Spanish character while offering all modern amenities. The landscape combines dramatic mountain backdrops with accessible beaches, creating diverse outdoor opportunities from hiking to water sports.
lifestyleSection: Living in Vera offers the perfect balance between relaxation and engagement. Your mornings might start with coffee at a local café overlooking the plaza, followed by a beach walk before the afternoon heat. The town has developed an enviable reputation among international residents seeking genuine Spanish life without tourist crowds. Mercadona and Lidl supermarkets provide everything from imported goods to local specialties, while weekly markets overflow with fresh Mediterranean produce. The established English-speaking expat community means seamless integration—you'll find friends who understand both the excitement and practicalities of relocating. Healthcare is excellent with a regional hospital 30 minutes away and private clinics offering English-speaking doctors. Dining options range from family-run chiringuitos serving fresh seafood on the beach to contemporary restaurants in town. The pace of life encourages socializing, whether at the beach, golf courses, or community events throughout the year.
investmentSection: This property represents a smart investment in Costa Blanca's growing market. Vera's real estate values have increased 8% year-on-year, outpacing many Spanish coastal areas. Holiday rental demand is strong, with comparable 3-bedroom properties generating approximately €800 per week during peak season. Your investment is backed by fundamental demand: international buyers seeking affordable Mediterranean properties, families looking for vacation bases, and retirees attracted to Vera's excellent climate and healthcare. At €3,722/m², you're paying 40% less than equivalent properties on Spanish islands like Mallorca or Menorca, while accessing the same lifestyle advantages. The established infrastructure and international community reduce renovation risks and simplify property management. Whether you rent seasonally or retain it as a personal retreat, this property offers compelling returns combined with genuine lifestyle benefits.
conclusion: This exceptional 3-bedroom bungalow in Vera represents everything you're seeking in a Mediterranean holiday home: authentic Spanish living, excellent value at €349,900, modern comfort, and proven rental income potential. Whether you envision extended family holidays, seasonal retreats, or strategic property investment, this property delivers on all fronts. The combination of location, climate, healthcare, and welcoming international community makes Vera an increasingly smart choice compared to overcrowded alternatives. With 300+ days of sunshine, beaches 20 minutes away, championship golf nearby, and strong tourist demand, your investment works for you whether you're enjoying it personally or generating rental income. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Vera provides all essential amenities and services expected in a modern Mediterranean town. The combination of local convenience and international infrastructure makes daily life effortless while maintaining authentic Spanish character.

healthcare.text: Healthcare standards in Vera and the surrounding Almería region are excellent. The regional hospital is located 30 minutes away by car and offers comprehensive medical services. For routine care, private clinics throughout the area employ English-speaking doctors familiar with international healthcare standards. Pharmacies are numerous and well-stocked, with many staff members speaking English. The established expat community means doctors have experience with international patients and understand their expectations. Emergency services are reliable and responsive, with ambulances available 24/7. Many international residents and visitors use private health insurance, which is affordable and provides access to premium facilities.

education.text: Vera and the surrounding region offer educational options suitable for international families. Several schools in the area follow British curriculum standards, important for children returning to UK education systems. International schools provide bilingual education and familiar teaching methodologies. Local Spanish schools are also excellent and provide cultural immersion. The international community has established support networks to help families navigate school selection and integration. Universities are accessible within reasonable distances for older students.

shopping.text: Shopping in Vera is convenient and comprehensive. Major supermarket chains like Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum are located throughout town with reasonable walking distances. Weekly markets offer fresh local produce, fish, and Mediterranean specialties at excellent prices. Specialist shops for bread, cheese, and meat maintain traditional Spanish shopping culture. Larger shopping centers are 30 minutes away in Almería city for brand-name clothing and electronics. The established expat community means shops stock familiar international brands alongside Spanish products.

transport.text: Getting around the Vera area is straightforward. A car is recommended for maximum flexibility, especially for beach trips and exploring the wider region. Public buses connect Vera to nearby towns and the coast. Alicante International Airport is 85 minutes drive and offers flights throughout Europe. Garrucha port, 12 minutes away, provides ferry services to nearby attractions. The road network is well-maintained and signage is clear. Parking is readily available and affordable throughout the town.

faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: €349,900. This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow offers premium specification at exceptional value, costing 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands while maintaining modern standards and excellent location in Vera's established community.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. EU citizens and most international buyers can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), which is straightforward to obtain. Many property agencies and lawyers specialize in assisting international buyers through the entire process.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent choice for property investment and lifestyle. Vera specifically offers authentic coastal living with strong rental demand, year-round sunshine, excellent healthcare, and established international communities. The region has experienced consistent property appreciation of 8% annually, with Vera offering significantly better value than overcrowded alternatives.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Vera is substantially lower than UK or northern Europe. Groceries, dining, and utilities are affordable due to local production and competitive supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl. Healthcare is excellent and either affordable privately or covered by Spanish healthcare systems. Most international residents report living comfortably on €1,200-1,500 monthly.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs in Spain include approximately 6-8% property transfer tax, legal fees (0.5-1%), and notary fees (0.3-0.5%). Your lawyer and real estate agent will provide detailed cost breakdowns. First-time buyers or those purchasing properties under certain values may qualify for tax reductions.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
faqs.answer: Alicante International Airport, serving Costa Blanca, is 85 minutes from Vera and offers direct flights to most major UK airports, typically 2-2.5 hours flight time. Regular budget airline flights make visiting family or traveling home convenient and affordable.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca, including Vera, enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine with mild winters and warm summers. Average temperatures range from 10-15°C in winter to 25-28°C in summer. Rainfall is minimal, and the microclimate around Vera is protected by mountains, creating consistently pleasant conditions ideal for year-round living.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to international buyers, typically covering 50-80% of property value. Interest rates are competitive. You'll need documentation including proof of income, identification, and tax status. Many buyers also explore mortgages through their home country banks.

faqs.question: Wat is het huurinkomstenpotentieel van dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: This 3-bedroom bungalow in Vera can generate approximately €800 weekly during peak season, equating to €3,200-4,000 monthly during summer months. Off-season rates are lower but steady demand exists year-round from retirees and families. Professional management services are available throughout Vera if you prefer hassle-free lettings.

faqs.question: Is Vera suitable for year-round living?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Vera's excellent climate, established international community, healthcare facilities, and modern amenities make it ideal for year-round residence. Many property owners enjoy extended stays combining lifestyle benefits with seasonal rental income during peak tourist months.
